instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SPI_MOSI: What is SPI_MOSI? SPI_MOSI is a signal between the CPU or PCH and the SPI ROM bios chip that is necessary for the machine to POST and boot. If this signal line is corroded or the BIOS chip has failed then you will not get PM_SLP_S4_L and the machine will not boot. Very often this line is corroded by liquid damage. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Hi

Hope you can help

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 MODEL POWERS UP BUT LIKE IT NEEDS CHARGER PUT IN THEN NO POWER TAKE CHARGER OUT AND BACK IN POWERS UP

BUT I DID NOTICE 2 CAPS ON <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> WHEN DOES NOT POWER UP VOLTAGE DROPPING <CAPACITOR>C7323</CAPACITOR>+<CAPACITOR>C7324</CAPACITOR> BUT OTHER CAPS WHICH ARE <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS</SIGNAL> ARE FIXED AT LIKE 8.29V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Please, don't write entire post in capitals.

Be more explicit.
The machine turns on with battery alone?
It turns of when you connect charger?
What is EXACT <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with charger alone (no battery)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Hi sorry about that
Seems with no battery
Like when charger is plugged in doesn't power up 
But if you take it out an put back in powers up


Seems like needs a kickstart

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?
This machine must turn on automatically when charger is plugged in, if no battery connected.
With battery in place, need to press the power button.

Do you always get amber light on Magsafe?
Even when doesn't turn on?
What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage in such case?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Hi
yes original charger 

Light comes on either time but when put in say 1st time in the day fan no spin
Don't know if its any connection
but <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> when fan doesnt spin has 0v 
When take magsafe and replace it back is 5v

Seems like something needs to be charged up first

threads.message:

8.2/3V and 8.5/6V is totally different thing!

threads.message:
That's normal.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> drops to 8.3V when machine doesn't want to turn on?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> level then.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Change <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>; you can force it with 10-47K.
Inspect J6100 for corrosion; clean, or even remove it, if needed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:

So im guessing the 100k is a little low reads around 88k

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Powering issue
threads.message:
Low readings is normal for onboard measurment.

Check if turns on always using 47K, instead of 100K.

Did you solder 47K, or 100K in place of <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>?
